```{r setup, include = FALSE}
library(R202)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>",
  fig.align = "center",
  warning = FALSE,
  message = FALSE,
  echo = FALSE,
  fig.width = 7,
  height = 6
)
```

When working in an RMarkdown file, formatting can sometimes be tricky. Adding the `asis` tag within a code chunk ensures that anything in the code chunk will be displayed as-is without formatting. Commands such as `echo` and `eval` still apply when an `asis` tag is used. To display an `asis` tag, use the following code:

\```{asis, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}

Anything goes here!

\```


Any code placed in this block will not be executed.
